Command.name: HCI_ACL_Data
Command.Macro:
_handle_ = %1 _text_ = %2 _bdry_ = %3 _brdcst_ = %4
_size_ = size(_text_)
_handle_ |= (((_bdry_ & 3)<<12) | ((_brdcst_ & 3) << 14))
_data_ = todata(2, 1) _data_ += todata(_handle_, 2)
if (g_bACL_L2CAP) then _data_ += todata(_size_, 2) _data_ += _text_ else _data_ += todata(_size_+4, 2) _data_ += todata(_size_, 2) _data_ += todata(0xDAD1, 2) _data_ += _text_ end if
WritePort _data_

Command.name: HCI_ACL_Data_Event
Command.Macro:
_timeout_ = %1 _handle_ = %2 _bdry_ = %3 _text_ = %4 _brdcst_ = %5
_size_ = size(_text_)
Wait_HCI_ACL_Packet_Event _timeout_, _handle_, _bdry_, _brdcst_, &_data_
if (!g_bACL_L2CAP) then # discard the L2CAP part _data_ = mid(_data_, 4) end if
if 0 != strcomp(_text_, _data_) then Fail "Text mismatch. Expected: \"%s\", Got: \"%s\"", _text_, str(_data_) end if

Param.Name: Timeout
Param.Desc: Time in msec to wait for the event

Command.name: HCI_L2CAP_Packet_Data
Command.Macro:
_handle_ = %1 _cid_ = %2 _data_ = %3 _brdcst_ = %4
# Only on init if _acl_size_ > 0 && _acl_count_ > 0 then # Already set, Do nothing else _acl_size_ = 0 _acl_count_ = 0 _acl_available_ = 0 end if
# Make sure we have the size of ACL packets and the buffers count if _acl_size_ == 0 || _acl_count_ == 0 then Send_HCI_Read_Buffer_Size Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_Read_Buffer_Size_Event 5000, any, HCI_Read_Buffer_Size, 0, &_acl_size_, any, &_acl_count_, any end if
# If still no information the error if _acl_size_ == 0 || _acl_count_ == 0 then Fail "ACL Buffer Size Error" end if
_acl_available_ = _acl_count_
# Create the whole payload (to be splited later for each ACL _data_ = todata(size(_data_), 2) + todata(_cid_,2) + todata(_data_) _size_ = size(_data_)
_pos_ = 0 _segment_ = _acl_size_
if _segment_ > 0 then while _pos_ < _size_
# Loop on all free buffers available while _pos_ < _size_ && _acl_available_ > 0 abPayload = mid(_data_, _pos_, _segment_) Send_HCI_ACL_Packet _handle_, _pos_==0 ? 2 : 1, _brdcst_, todata(abPayload) _pos_ += _segment_ _acl_available_-- wend
Wait_HCI_Number_Of_Completed_Packets_Event 45000, 0x01, _handle_, &_freed_ _acl_available_ += _freed_ wend
# Wait for all completed events that still need to come up while _acl_available_ < _acl_count_ Wait_HCI_Number_Of_Completed_Packets_Event 45000, 0x01, _handle_, &_freed_ _acl_available_ += _freed_ wend end if

Command.name: HCI_L2CAP_Packet
Command.Macro:
_handle_ = %1 _cid_ = %2 _data_ = %3 _brdcst_ = %4
# Only on init if _acl_size_ > 0 && _acl_count_ > 0 then # Already set, Do nothing else _acl_size_ = 0 _acl_count_ = 0 _acl_available_ = 0 end if
# Make sure we have the size of ACL packets and the buffers count if _acl_size_ == 0 || _acl_count_ == 0 then Send_HCI_Read_Buffer_Size Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_Read_Buffer_Size_Event 5000, any, HCI_Read_Buffer_Size, 0, &_acl_size_, any, &_acl_count_, any end if
# If still no information the error if _acl_size_ == 0 || _acl_count_ == 0 then Fail "ACL Buffer Size Error" end if
_acl_available_ = _acl_count_
# Create the whole payload (to be splited later for each ACL _data_ = todata(size(_data_)+1, 2) + todata(_cid_,2) + todata(_data_) + todata(0, 1) _size_ = size(_data_)
_pos_ = 0 _segment_ = _acl_size_
if _segment_ > 0 then while _pos_ < _size_
# Loop on all free buffers available while _pos_ < _size_ && _acl_available_ > 0 abPayload = mid(_data_, _pos_, _segment_) Send_HCI_ACL_Packet _handle_, _pos_==0 ? 2 : 1, _brdcst_, todata(abPayload) _pos_ += _segment_ _acl_available_-- wend
Wait_HCI_Number_Of_Completed_Packets_Event 45000, 0x01, _handle_, &_freed_ _acl_available_ += _freed_ wend
# Wait for all completed events that still need to come up while _acl_available_ < _acl_count_ Wait_HCI_Number_Of_Completed_Packets_Event 45000, 0x01, _handle_, &_freed_ _acl_available_ += _freed_ wend end if

Command.name: HCI_L2CAP_Packet_Event
Command.Macro:
_timeout_ = %1 _handle_ = %2 _cid_ = %3 _text_ = %4
_size_ = size(_text_) _got_ = 0
while _got_ < _size_ Wait_HCI_ACL_Packet_Event _timeout_, _handle_, _got_==0 ? 2 : 1, any, &_data_
if (_got_==0) then
# Match CID _cidin_ = val(mid(_data_, 2, 2)) if _cid_ != _cidin_ then Fail "CID mismatch. Expected: 0x%04x, Got: 0x%04x", _cid_, _cidin_ end if
_whole_ = mid(_data_, 4) _got_ += size(_data_) - 4
else
_whole_ += _data_ _got_ += size(_data_)
end if
wend
# Match text if 0 != strcomp(_text_, _whole_) then Fail "Text mismatch. Expected: \"%s\", Got: \"%s\"", _text_, str(_whole_) end if

Param.Name: Timeout
Param.Desc: Time in msec to wait for the event

Command.name: HCI_ACL_Data_Types
Command.Macro:
_handle_ = %1 _type_ = %2 _path_ = %3 _bdry_ = %4 _brdcst_ = %5 _fmt_ = %6
If _type_==1 Then Send_HCI_ACL_L2CAP_Text _handle_, _bdry_, _brdcst_, 0xDad1, _path_ Else # Extract the file name without the path _pos_ = InStrRev(_path_, "\\")
if (_pos_ >= 0) then _name_ = mid(_path_, _pos_+1) else _name_ = _path_ end if
if _fmt_==2 then LoadFile _FileData_, _path_ _size_ = size(_FileData_) Send_HCI_L2CAP_Packet_Data _handle_, 0xDA00, todata(_name_) + todata(0, 1) + _FileData_, _brdcst_ else # Only on init if _acl_size_ > 0 && _acl_count_ > 0 then # Already set, Do nothing else _acl_size_ = 0 _acl_count_ = 0 _acl_available_ = 0 end if
# Make sure we have the size of ACL packets and the buffers count if _acl_size_ == 0 || _acl_count_ == 0 then Send_HCI_Read_Buffer_Size Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_Read_Buffer_Size_Event 5000, any, HCI_Read_Buffer_Size, 0, &_acl_size_, any, &_acl_count_, any end if
# If still no information the error if _acl_size_ == 0 || _acl_count_ == 0 then Fail "ACL Buffer Size Error" end if
_acl_available_ = _acl_count_
############################## # Write Header ##############################
LoadFile _FileData_, _path_
_size_ = size(_FileData_) abHeaderData = todata(_size_, 4) + todata(_name_) + todata(0, 1)
Send_HCI_ACL_L2CAP_Data _handle_, _bdry_, _brdcst_, 0xDada, abHeaderData
_acl_available_-- _pos_ = 0 _segment_ = _acl_size_ - 4
if _segment_ > 0 then while _pos_ < _size_
# Loop on all free buffers available while _pos_ < _size_ && _acl_available_ > 0 abPayload = mid(_FileData_, _pos_, _segment_) Send_HCI_ACL_L2CAP_Data _handle_, _bdry_, _brdcst_, 0xDada, abPayload _pos_ += _segment_ _acl_available_-- wend
Wait_HCI_Number_Of_Completed_Packets_Event 45000, 0x01, _handle_, &_freed_ _acl_available_ += _freed_ WEnd
# Wait for all completed events that still need to come up while _acl_available_ < _acl_count_ Wait_HCI_Number_Of_Completed_Packets_Event 45000, 0x01, _handle_, &_freed_ _acl_available_ += _freed_ WEnd End If End If End If

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: HCIPP Read Modify Write Hardware Register

Param.Name: Value
Param.Desc: The value to be written. Bits that equal 0 in the mask will be ignored.

Param.Name: Mask
Param.Desc: The bit mask of the bits that will be over-written. In every bit: 0=No change 1=Change.

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: HCIPP Read Manipulate Write Hardware Register

Param.Name: Read Mask
Param.Desc: The bit mask of the bits that will be manipulated. In every bit: 0=ignore 1=Change.

Param.Name: Write Address
Param.Desc: HW register address to be writen(32 bit)

Param.Name: Write Mask
Param.Desc: The bit mask of the bits that will be manipulated. In every bit: 0=ignore 1=Change.

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: HCIPP configures the BRF6300 fast clock configuration

Param.Name: Fast wakeup enable
Param.Desc: 0x00 - disabled For BT and FM. 0x01 - enabled For BT, disabled for FM. 0x10 - enabled For FM, disabled for BT. 0x11 - enabled For BT and FM. 0xFF - Dont Change.

Param.Name: XTAL Boost Gain
Param.Desc: This parameter determines the initial gain of the OSC cell

Param.Name: XTAL Normal Gain
Param.Desc: This parameter determines the steady state gain of the OSC cell

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: Reserved, for 6450 must be set to 0xFF

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: HCIPP enables/disables the BRF6300 BB PLL

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: HCI_VS_Set_pll_mode, configure parameters of BRF6350 PLL

Param.Name: PLL Frequency mode
Param.Desc: Set Output frequency of PLL, mode 0 Europe (28M), mode 1 Japan (24M)

Param.Name: PLL divider mode 0 (Europe)
Param.Desc: PLL divider used when bypassing divider calculation (default given for for 13MHz FREF with override), 0 means calculate according to fref, 0xFFFFFFFF means do not change

Param.Name: PLL divider mode 1 (Japan)
Param.Desc: PLL divider used when bypassing divider calculation (default given for for 13MHz FREF with override), 0 means calculate according to fref, 0xFFFFFFFF means do not change

Param.Name: Number of temperature ranges
Param.Desc: Number of temperature ranges that infuance the FREF clock

Param.Name: GFSK Default Range 0
Param.Desc: Default Pattern, DRP clock below Frequency range limit

Param.Name: GFSK Default Range 1
Param.Desc: Default Pattern, DRP clock above Frequency range limit

Param.Name: GFSK ZOZO Range 0
Param.Desc: ZOZO Pattern, DRP clock below Frequency range limit

Param.Name: GFSK ZOZO Range 1
Param.Desc: ZOZO Pattern, DRP clock above Frequency range limit

Param.Name: Not Used
Param.Desc: Do not change default value, 0xFF: Don't change

Param.Name: GFSK Default Range 0
Param.Desc: Default Pattern, DRP clock below Frequency range limit, 0xFF: Don't change

Param.Name: GFSK Default Range 1
Param.Desc: Default Pattern, DRP clock above Frequency range limit, 0xFF: Don't change

Param.Name: GFSK ZOZO Range 0
Param.Desc: ZOZO Pattern, DRP clock below Frequency range limit, 0xFF: Don't change

Param.Name: GFSK ZOZO Range 1
Param.Desc: ZOZO Pattern, DRP clock above Frequency range limit, 0xFF: Don't change

Param.Name: Modulation Inv Osr
Param.Desc: 8 MSB of the 1/drp_clock, which are used in modulation index calculation, 0xFF: Don't change

Param.Name: ZOZO Modulation Multiplier (x100 times)
Param.Desc: Number in percentage of modulation multiplier used for ZOZO, , 0xFF: Don't change

Param.Name: Default Modulation Multiplier (x100 times)
Param.Desc: Number in percentage of modulation multiplier used for default, , 0xFF: Don't change

Param.Name: Reserved for future usage
Param.Desc: Reserved for future usage, 0xFFFF: Don't change

Param.Name: Reserved for future usage
Param.Desc: Reserved for future usage, 0xFFFF: Don't change

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: HCI VS DRP Enable RF Calibration

Param.Name: Mode
Param.Desc: 0x00: Calibrate once, 0x01-0xFD: Period length (x10 Secs), 0xFE: Keep periodic calibration, 0xFF: Stop periodic calibration.

Param.Name: Override Temp Condition
Param.Desc: 0x00: Run selected calibrations only if temp range changed, 0x01: Run selected calibrations regardless of temp range changes

Param.Desc: HCIPP DRP Set RF Adc Cal Ext Params

Param.Desc: HCIPP DRP Enable RF Calibration Extended

Command.name: HCI_VS_DRP_Set_transmitter_class
Command.Param: Transmitter classClass_Mode 0x00 0x00: Class 1.5 is disabled, 0x01: Class 1.5 enabled for GFSK traffic, 0x02: Class 1.5 enabled for GFSK and EDR2 traffic, 0x04: Class 1.5 enabled for GFSK, EDR2 and EDR3 traffic, 0xFF: Don't change.

Param.Name: GFSK Peak Power [uW]
Param.Desc: Values : 3162 - 10000 ,5 dBm - 10 dBm (P W = 10 ^ (PdBm/10) * 1e3 , Initial value = 10000 , 0xffff : Don't change.

Param.Name: EDR Peak Power [uW]
Param.Desc: Values : 3162 - 5012 ,5 dBm - 7 dBm (P W = 10 ^ (PdBm/10) * 1e3 , Initial value = 5012 , 0xffff : Don't change.

Param.Name: Step Size [uW]
Param.Desc: Values : 1585 - 1778 ,4 dB - 5 dB (P W = 10 ^ (PdB/20) * 1e3 , Initial value = 1585 , 0xffff : Don't change.

Param.Desc: HCIPP Write CODEC Configuration for Island2

Param.Name: PCM clock rate
Param.Desc: [0x40-0xC00] The PCM clock rate is between 64k to 3072k, it influence other parameters like wait cycles and frequency rate calculation

Param.Name: PCM clock direction
Param.Desc: bit 0 - PCM clock direction: 0 - output, 1 - input. bit 1 - Clock Polarity: 0 - rising edge. 1 - falling edge.

Param.Name: Frame sync frequency
Param.Desc: [0x01-0x0a] Actual frame sync frequency is the configured value multiply with 8Khz, e.g. 2 is frequency of 16Khz

Param.Name: Frame sync duty cycle
Param.Desc: 0x1 - 1 cycle of PCM clock, 0x2 - 2 cycles of PCM clock, 0x3 - 50% of data size, 0x4 - 100% of data size, 0x5 - 50 % of Fsync period

Param.Name: Frame sync direction
Param.Desc: 0x0 - Output (master on PCM bus), 0x1 - Input (slave on PCM bus)

Param.Name: CH#1 data size
Param.Desc: [0x01-0x50] Sample size in bits for each codec fsync. The maximal value when 2 channels are active is 40 for each channel. [0x0] - Channel not used

Param.Name: CH#1 data offset
Param.Desc: [0x01-0xFF] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start (to msb)

Param.Name: CH#1 padding start
Param.Desc: [0x1-0x7] Placement of padding bits, [0xFF] No padding

Param.Name: CH#1 padding value
Param.Desc: [0x00-0x7F] Value to put in padding word (Depending on the number of padding bits)

Param.Name: CH#2 data size
Param.Desc: [0x01-0x50] Sample size in bits for each codec fsync. The maximal value when 2 channels are active is 40 for each channel. [0x0] - Channel not used

Param.Name: CH#2 data offset
Param.Desc: [0x01-0x50] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start (to msb)

Param.Name: CH#2 padding start
Param.Desc: [0x1-0x7] Placement of padding bits, [0xFF] No padding

Param.Name: CH#2 padding value
Param.Desc: [0x00-0x7F] Value to put in padding word (Depending on the number of padding bits)

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: HCIPP Write CODEC Configuration for Island3

Param.Name: PCM clock rate
Param.Desc: [64-16000] The PCM clock rate is between 64k to 4096k (Master mode) or 64K to 16M (Slave mode), it influence other params like: wait cycles, freq rate calcs and therefore shall be configured even if external clock is used

Param.Name: PCM direction/role
Param.Desc: PCM clock and fsync direction: 0x00 - output (Master on PCM bus) sampled on rising edge. 0x01 - input (Slave on PCM bus).

Param.Name: Frame sync frequency
Param.Desc: [100Hz-173KHz] Actual frame sync frequency in Hz.

Param.Name: Frame sync duty cycle
Param.Desc: 0x0000 - 50 % of Fsync period, [0x0001-0xFFFF] - Number of PCM clock cycles

Param.Name: Frame sync edge
Param.Desc: 0x00 - Driven/sampled at rising edge, 0x01 - Driven/sampled at falling edge

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: This field is reserved for future use - Must be set to 0.

Param.Name: CH1 data out size
Param.Desc: [0x0001-0x0280] Sample size in bits for each codec fsync. In case data size is greater than 24 bits, the size should be able to divide by 8.

Param.Name: CH1 data out offset
Param.Desc: [0x00-0xFF] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start.

Param.Name: CH1 out_edge
Param.Desc: Data driven: 0x00 - rising edge, 0x01 - falling edge

Param.Name: CH1 data in size
Param.Desc: [0x0001-0x0280] Sample size in bits for each codec fsync. In case data size is greater than 24 bits, the size should be able to divide by 8.

Param.Name: CH1 data in offset
Param.Desc: [0x00-0xFF] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start.

Param.Name: CH1 in_edge
Param.Desc: Data sampled: 0x00- rising edge, 0x01 - falling edge

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: This field is reserved for future use - Must be set to 0.

Param.Name: CH2 data out size
Param.Desc: [0x0001-0x0280] Sample size in bits for each codec fsync. In case data size is greater than 24 bits, the size should be able to divide by 8.

Param.Name: CH2 data out offset
Param.Desc: [0x00-0xFF] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start.

Param.Name: CH2 out_edge
Param.Desc: Data driven: 0x00 - rising edge, 0x01 - falling edge

Param.Name: CH2 data in size
Param.Desc: [0x0001-0x0280] Sample size in bits for each codec fsync. In case data size is greater than 24 bits, the size should be able to divide by 8.

Param.Name: CH2 data in offset
Param.Desc: [0x00-0xFF] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start.

Param.Name: CH2 in_edge
Param.Desc: Data sampled: 0x00- rising edge, 0x01 - falling edge

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: This field is reserved for future use - Must be set to 0.

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: HCIPP Write CODEC Configuration for Island3

Param.Name: PCM clock shutdown
Param.Desc: PCM clock shutdown feature: 0x00 - disabled. 0x01 - enabled. Time of start stop is defined in the following 2 fields.

Param.Name: PCM clock start
Param.Desc: [0x0000-0xFFFF] Number of PCM clock cycles relative to the PCM frame sync to start PCM clock (for example - start 2 clocks before frame sync).

Param.Name: PCM clock stop
Param.Desc: [0x0000-0xFFFF] Number of PCM clock cycles relative to the PCM frame sync to stop PCM clock (for example - stop 20 clocks after frame sync).

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: This field is reserved for future use - Must be set to 0.

Param.Name: CH1 data in order
Param.Desc: bit 0: 0-Data driven MSB-first; bit 1: 1-swap bytes within the sample in bit-wise mode; bit 2: 1-Shift sample by (24|16-dout_size) bits

Param.Name: CH1 data out order
Param.Desc: bit 0: 0-Data driven MSB-first; bit 1: 1-swap bytes within the sample in bit-wise mode; bit 2: 1-Shift sample by (24|16-dout_size) bits

Param.Name: CH1 data out mode
Param.Desc: 0 - Always 3-state (input), 1 - Always output, 2 - Switch to 3-state (input) when idle

Param.Name: CH1 data out dup
Param.Desc: 0 - Retransmit last sample when no data available, 1 - Transmit DUP_VALUE when no data available

Param.Name: CH1 tx_dup_value
Param.Desc: Replacement value to transmit when no data is available. ONLY 24-bits

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: This field is reserved for future use - Must be set to 0.

Param.Name: CH2 data in order
Param.Desc: bit 0: 0-Data driven MSB-first; bit 1: 1-swap bytes within the sample in bit-wise mode; bit 2: 1-Shift sample by (24|16-dout_size) bits

Param.Name: CH2 data out order
Param.Desc: bit 0: 0-Data driven MSB-first; bit 1: 1-swap bytes within the sample in bit-wise mode; bit 2: 1-Shift sample by (24|16-dout_size) bits

Param.Name: CH2 data out mode
Param.Desc: 0 - Always 3-state (input), 1 - Always output, 2 - Switch to 3-state (input) when idle

Param.Name: CH2 data out dup
Param.Desc: 0 - Retransmit last sample when no data available, 1 - Transmit DUP_VALUE when no data available

Param.Name: CH2 tx_dup_value
Param.Desc: Replacement value to transmit when no data is available. ONLY 24-bits

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: This field is reserved for future use - Must be set to 0.

Param.Name: EPLC enable
Param.Desc: Enhanced packet loss control feature: 0 - diabled, 1 - enabled. Enable only when there is no active voice connection.

Param.Name: EPLC R value
Param.Desc: [0-15] R parameter used in EPLC (previous packet transmissions count), recommended max of 3. Updated only when enabling.

Param.Name: EPLC N value
Param.Desc: [0-15] N parameter used in EPLC (noise packet transmissions count). Updated only when enabling.

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: This field is reserved for future use

Param.Desc: [0x40-0xC00] The PCM clock rate is between 64k to 3072k, it influence other parameters like wait cycles and frequency rate calculation

Param.Name: PCM clock direction
Param.Desc: 0x0 - PCM clock direction is output (codec_IF clock is Master on PCM bus). 0x1 - PCM clock direction is input (codec_IF clock is Slave on PCM bus)

Param.Name: Frame sync frequency
Param.Desc: [0x01-0x0a] Actual frame sync frequency is the configured value multiply with 8Khz, e.g. 2 is frequency of 16Khz

Param.Name: Frame sync duty cycle
Param.Desc: 0x1 - 1 cycle of PCM clock, 0x2 - 2 cycles of PCM clock, 0x3 - 50% of data size, 0x4 - 100% of data size

Param.Name: Frame sync direction
Param.Desc: 0x0 - Output (master on PCM bus), 0x1 - Input (slave on PCM bus)

Param.Name: CH#1 data size
Param.Desc: [0x01-0x50] Sample size in bits for each codec fsync. The maximal value when 2 channels are active is 40 for each channel. [0x0] - Channel not used

Param.Name: CH#1 data offset
Param.Desc: [0x01-0x50] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start (to msb)

Param.Name: CH#1 padding start
Param.Desc: [0x1-0x7] Placement of padding bits, [0xFF] No padding

Param.Name: CH#1 padding value
Param.Desc: [0x00-0x7F] Value to put in padding word (Depending on the number of padding bits)

Param.Name: CH#2 data size
Param.Desc: [0x01-0x50] Sample size in bits for each codec fsync. The maximal value when 2 channels are active is 40 for each channel. [0x0] - Channel not used

Param.Name: CH#2 data offset
Param.Desc: [0x01-0x50] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start (to msb)

Param.Name: CH#2 padding start
Param.Desc: [0x1-0x7] Placement of padding bits, [0xFF] No padding

Param.Name: CH#2 padding value
Param.Desc: [0x00-0x7F] Value to put in padding word (Depending on the number of padding bits)

Param.Name: Polarity
Param.Desc: 0- Active Low Polarity, 1- Active High Polarity

Param.Name: Enable/Disable Pull on Data Bus (D0 - D15)
QOS Interval
Param.Desc: Poll period (a poll will be sent every poll period frames) Range: 1 - 255.

Param.Desc: The maximum ratio between the allocation of slots for guranteed service and best effort service: 1-50.

Command.name: HCIPP_Set_IO_Pin_Mux
Command.Macro:
_IO_Pin_Number = %1 _Mux_Select = %2 _BitShift = _IO_Pin_Number % 5 If _BitShift == 0 Then _BitShift = 5 End If _BitsToSend = (_Mux_Select - 1) << 3*(_BitShift-1) _BitsMask = 7 << 3*(_BitShift-1) _Pin_Group = (_IO_Pin_Number-1) / 5 _Register_Address = 0x1af600 + (_Pin_Group << 1) log "Pin Number 0x%x", _IO_Pin_Number log "Mux_Select 0x%x", _Mux_Select log "_BitShift 0x%x", _BitShift log "_BitsToSend 0x%x", _BitsToSend log "_BitsMask 0x%x", _BitsMask log "_Pin_Group 0x%x", _Pin_Group log "_Register_Address 0x%x", _Register_Address
If (_IO_Pin_Number == 0x0f || _IO_Pin_Number == 0x36 || _IO_Pin_Number == 0x38) Then log " _Mux_Select : 0x%x",_Mux_Select If (_Mux_Select == 0x07 || _Mux_Select == 0x09) then Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001AF64c, 0x0070, 0x0070 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 Else Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001AF64c, 0x0000, 0x0070 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 End If End If
Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, _Register_Address, _BitsToSend, _BitsMask Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
